trans-unit.source: A Python module to access Java classes as Python classes using JNI.
trans-unit.target: Un m칩dulo Python para acceder a las clases de Java como clases Python usando JNI.

trans-unit.source: A Python module to access Java classes as Python classes using the Java Native Interface (JNI). Warning: the pypi name is now pyjnius instead of jnius.
trans-unit.target: A Python module to access Java classes as Python classes using the Java Native Interface (JNI). Warning: the pypi name is now pyjnius instead of jnius .

trans-unit.source: Compile a distribution with kivy (PyJNIus will be automatically added)

trans-unit.source: Each pair contains the list of accepted arguments types, and the returned type.
trans-unit.target: Cada par contiene la lista de tipos de argumentos aceptados,y el tipo devuelto.

trans-unit.source: If you need assistance, you can ask for help on our mailing list:
trans-unit.target: Si necesita ayuda,puede pedirla en nuestra lista de correo:

trans-unit.source: Make sure a Java Development Kit (JDK) is installed on your operating system if you want to use PyJNIus on desktop. OpenJDK is known to work, and the Oracle Java JDK should work as well.
trans-unit.target: Aseg칰rate de tener instalado un kit de desarrollo de Java (JDK)en tu sistema operativo si quieres usar PyJNIus en el escritorio.Se sabe que OpenJDK funciona,y el JDK de Java de Oracle tambi칠n deber칤a funcionar.

trans-unit.source: On windows, make sure JAVA_HOME points to your java installation, so PyJNIus can locate the jvm.dll file allowing it to start java. This shouldn't be necessary on OSX and Linux, but in case PyJNIus fails to find it, setting JAVA_HOME should help.
trans-unit.target: On windows, make sure JAVA_HOME points to your java installation, so PyJNIus can locate the jvm.dll file allowing it to start java. This shouldn't be necessary on OSX and Linux, but in case PyJNIus fails to find it, setting JAVA_HOME should help.

trans-unit.source: You can use the signatures method of JavaMethod and JavaMultipleMethod, to inspect the discovered signatures of a method of an object
trans-unit.target: You can use the signatures method of JavaMethod and JavaMultipleMethod , to inspect the discovered signatures of a method of an object
